author: Louis
title: Burblr - let's make books fun.
description: NFTs are confusing. There's a need for an intuitive Dapp that can bridge the gap between mass adoption, utility, and most importantly, fun.

assessments.note: This could be an interesting DApp. However why would people want NFT's of an  ebook? How do you manage the original sellers who can sell infinite copies at marginal cost of zero vs second hand sales?
assessments.reply: The supporting attachments specifically the FAQ Showcase PDF, delves into why an NFT corresponding to an eBook or audiobook would be interesting.  The PDF also clarifies that the eBook and audiobook would not be the NFT  itself, rather there would be accompanying NFTs of exclusive content for selective works.  In other words - our dapp is essentially a blockchain bookstore where you can buy eBooks and audiobooks with $ADA or a credit card.  You can then showcase your collection and engage with the Burblr Community.  In addition, there would be Box Drops that would contain new eBooks and audiobooks as well as the chance to receive exclusive author content in the form of NFTs.

assessments.note: The proposal adds a application of NFTs to the Cardano ecosystem that will benefit creators of literature, thus it is a great addition. It has a detailed concept and many well-reflected features

the proposal aims to fundamentally shift the publication distribution model in a fun way, while also providing a traceable authenticity to the article. All of this wrapped up in a game and less disruptive package using new Works.

The idea is interesting and has the potential to increase adoption. The attached pdf is certainly helpful to communicate key points. However, since the usage of ADA is merely a side-note and the case for fiat is made (plus prices are denoted in $), it is unclear how this would actually help Cardano.
assessments.reply: The proposal as well as the supporting attachments clearly articulate that eBooks and audiobooks can be purchased with $ADA and/or a credit card.  This is intentional as the challenge calls for dapps that will add the most value to end users, it's our view that having the choice to pay with $ADA or a credit is paramount to successfully growing the Cardano ecosystem by increasing the amount of overall end users.

assessments.note: A very well thought out proposal. There is so much to build on here, one that would definitely resonate with a large audience.

Plan is relatively detailed. It would be good if there was evidence to back up the experience of the proposers (ie linkedin profiles). Do they have connections in the publishing world? Is there a market for this product? What platform are the books to be read on?
assessments.reply: The proposal as well as supporting attachments state that the eBooks and audiobooks would be accessed from Burblr.  We hear and understand the request for additional transparency and are glad to provide CVs and references upon request in addition to email exchanges and anything else within reason, however it is important to note that something such as a LinkedIn profile is just as subjective as a bio written anywhere else.  Furthermore, we are glad to provide LinkedIn Profiles for Team Members that utilize that social media.

assessments.note: The proposal puts long standing publishing models to the test, and offers a disruptive alternative. What isn't clear is how the media will be linked to the NFT, and if the media will be stored in perpetuity by burblr, hosted on some authenticated server, or even if the user would like to host their own copy on a local machine for offline use. If someone can't verify the checksum of the media themselves and can't store their own copies then that might be a significant speed bump in the plan. This is to protect the asset in case that burblr is no longer capable of distributing the Works themselves, in lets say 200 years.
The team introduction is acceptable, but it would have been more meaningful if verifiable information was provided.
assessments.reply: Essentially this is a duplicate comment.

assessments.note: Plan and resources look sensible. Only concern is budget, seems low. Can the non-tech work really be done gratis or should you look at coming back for further funding to help. I think the community would get behind this one if they see a POC after 3 months

Apart from a not-so detailed budget, which can be tolerated due to the business-related experience of the proposers, the proposal is very detailed and structured, making it possible to evaluate it with confidence.
the proposal includes key milestone dates and mentions metrics but doesn't include goals on how many signups, how many works are published and so on.

The proposal does not mention laying out the progress via open source, instead a "proprietary algorithm" will be used. The timeline does not mention the actual completion or delivery of the dapp(s) to users. Therefore, the information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
assessments.reply: The proposal and supporting attachments clearly specify that the algorithm would be used to curate content for future Box Drops, which has zero impact on documenting development progress.  Development progress would be public and transparent as is demonstrably shown via updates starting to be posted on Burblr.io.  The proposal and attachments also outline a timeline for development and delivery to users, including details on what mediums the dapp would be available on as well as other associated milestones included with each phase.

assessments.note: milestones and deliverables are clear, this one will be very simple to track

solution: Team Burblr is connecting humans to Cardano by allowing them to collect and trade NFT audio/eBooks in a gamified way, with a credit card.
experience: 2 senior developers & 2 executive sales/marketing professionals with proven track records of success in startup & institutional capacities.
